page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The A9 divides the area into two: each with its own landscape. South of the A9 lies a relatively level area which is a "raised beach" and the associated cliff can best be seen at Broomhill Farm (GR 719716).North of the roadthe land,in contrast is undulating - the result of extensive glacial deposition:moraine and eskers. Man's impact on the landscape has been considerable ranging from the rectangular pattern of fields to the scattered farm buildings and in particular the large houses associated with estates - Kincraig and Newmore Houses. Kincraig House (GR 692710) is one of the area's dominating features. An imposing structure of dressed local sandstone it was built by the Mackenzi
